thread.title: Donison annexes overall title in style
thread.title_full: Donison annexes overall title in style - The Times of India

author: Shrivathsa Sridhar
title: Donison annexes overall title in style
text:
Local lad Ricky Donison emerged triumphant by a big margin in the final race of the Senior Max category in the fifth round of the 12th JK Tyre-FMSCI National Karting Championship at the Meco Kartopia on Sunday.
The victory ensured Donison also took the overall championship and the individual awards for the maximum number of wins and pole positions. Donison, who finished with a timing of 18:09.290 in the 20-lap final race, finished ahead of Vishnu Prasad (18:17.966) and Nayan Chatterjee (18:22.488).
Nikhil Bohra, who won his final race in the Micro Max category, couldn't prevent his rival Shahan Ali Mohsin from running away with the overall crown. In the Junior Max category, Mohammed Nallwala claimed the honours but it was local lad Akash Gowda who took the overall title.
The overall champions of the Junior Max and Senior Max will participate in the World Karting finals to be held in Portugal this year. The top three overall champions in the Junior Max and Senior Max category will be seen driving the JKFB02 cars in the JK Tyre Racing Championship 2016.
Results (provisional): Micro Max (15 laps): 1. Nikhil Bohra (14:59.428); 2. Shahan Ali Mohsin (15:02.508); 3. Ruhaan Alva (15:02.832).
Junior Max (18 laps): 1. Mohammed Nallwala (16:18.543); 2. Nirmal Umashanker (16:19.821); 3. Akash Gowda (16:25.426).
Senior Max (20 laps): 1. Ricky Donison (18:09.290); 2. Vishnu Prasad (18:17.966); 3. Nayan Chatterjee (18:22.488).
Overall championship: Micro Max: 1. Shahan Ali Mohsin (435 points); 2. Ruhaan Alva (413); 3. Nikhil Bohra (412). Junior Max: 1. Akash Gowda (413); 2. Mohammed Nallwalla (406); 3. Nirmal Umashanker (396). Senior Max: 1. Ricky Donison (424); 2. Nayan Chatterjee (411); 3. Dhruv Mohite (396).
